name: Casa Turrent - Serie 1942 - Torpedo
additionalNotes: Named for the birth year of Alejandro Turrent's father, Casa Turrent Serie 1942 cigars feature a Mexican San Andrés Negro Colorado wrapper over a San Andrés Criollo leaf binder with San Andres Criollo, Negro, and Nicaraguan long-fillers. All of the tobaccos are aged for a minimum of four years and chosen from the upper part of the plant for their richer flavor. Geared for more experienced cigar smokers, but restrained enough for some newer cigar smokers, the cigars are box-pressed, medium to full in body, and offer a spicy, full-flavored smoke with a long, velvety finish.
